pair.Response:
Prompt: Northern Securities Co. v. United States, 193 U.S. 251 (1903)
Response: In this case, the Supreme Court held that the firm of J.P. Morgan & Company had lawfully purchased shares of the Northern Pacific Company from the Oregon Short Line Railroad Company, and that the Northern Securities Company had lawfully purchased all the shares of the Northern Pacific Company and the Great Northern Company, with the general object of holding these interests together and developing the company's system and the territory served by it. The Court found that none of these purchases were made with intent to violate the statute or common law of any State or of the United States, and were not in violation of any such law.
